column2: Australian banks narrow focus of Apple Pay collective bargaining request SYDNEY
column3: Feb 13 Australian banks seeking permission from the country's competition regulator to bargain collectively with Apple Inc over its mobile payment system said on Monday they will focus on gaining access to the U.S. tech company's contactless payment function
column4: removing the fees Apple charges as a bone of contention. ~

column3: Kmart cap week of controversy for Trump brands Feb 11 Trump-branded consumer products have suffered new blows
column4: with U.S. retailers Sears Holdings Corp  and Kmart Corp  discontinuing online sales of 31 Trump Home items
column5: while new details emerged showing sales of Ivanka Trump's brand fell in the weeks before Nordstrom Inc  stopped carrying her products. ~

column2: Missing worker believed dead in Phillips 66 pipeline blast HOUSTON
column3: Feb 11 A worker missing since a Thursday night explosion at a Phillips 66 natural gas liquids pipeline station in Louisiana is believed dead
column4: the company said on Saturday. ~One worker remains hospitalized from Phillips 66 Ferndale leak HOUSTON One contract worker remained hospitalized on Saturday after a hydrofluoric acid leak at Phillips 66's Ferndale
column7: the company said in a statement. ~
